reviews.sentence: can not beat a Hampton Inn. Hampton Inns are always a good choice when stopping on a road trip. This one was recommended by my parents and we were not disappointed. There are plenty of food choices around the rooms were clean the free breakfast was great and the beds were comfy. The only issue we had was when we went by car to the shell gas station around the corner. When we first pulled up there was a guy in a white pickup leaving and when we were leaving the same pickup came back in front of us and before the pickup came to a stop another guy jumped out and started coming toward us and kind waving like he wanted something. Not being from anywhere near this town there was no way he needed something from us and he was old enough to buy his own alcohol and cigarettes so it was strange that he was coming at us like that. I am not sure how safe this area is because of what we experienced but it was just strange. If you go anywhere drive do not walk.
Clean pleasant employesNo refrigerator in room.

Convenient Location Many Freebies. I chose this Hampton due to its location just off I75. It is near shopping restaurants and a very nice movie theater. The hotel is typical Hampton very clean nice room furnishings and free breakfast parking and Wi Fi. Pets are allowed which was no problem for me. Staff was friendly and the breakfast was plentiful. The location is great for those not wishing to stay downtown.

A nice place to sleep. Nice clean well managed hotel. Comfy bed good hot shower good climate control nice breakfast. Nice relaxing environment with helpful staff. Upon arrival we were quickly greeted given room assignment and found the cookies and coffee they have a nice way of making u feel at home.

Nice Room. Nice Stay. We found our room spacious enough clean and comfortable. The bed was not quite as comfy as I expected but certainly good. The room included typical amenities like hair dryer shampoo etc but also included a microwave and refrigerator. Even though our room was just two doors away from the ice maker we found it quiet. The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was included and had quite a few items including hot eggs and ham as well as oatmeal. There was also fresh fruit and pastries. Being there on the weekend the dining area was very crowded and not as relaxed as we wished but no one could help this. Parking was handy with lots available near the front door. All in all we found this hotel great for our needs and at a good price. I would both stay there again and recommend this hotel to others.

Old but clean. Stayed here overnight last week as we travelled from Florida back home to Canada. It was terrific for an overnight stay. Our room was rather worn but it was impeccably clean and the beds were comfortable and that is what we needed. The complimentary breakfast was very good. We travel with a little dog and this hotel is welcoming to dogs. Lots of restaurants close by for a quick meal. Best of all easy access to the I75 Easy off the highway and easy back on in the morning.

Very Nice Stay by Airport. We were welcomed as we walked in the hotel and check. in was efficient. The hotel room was clean and nice and fit our needs. The cost was very competitive and we were pleased with the savings. The breakfast the next day was very tasty and better than we expected as we left for our flight.

Great Stay. I enjoyed the stay everything was great as usual. the room I had did not have a fridge or microwave but was very clean and comfy great stay. The guest service was great and I was rated greeted as a H Honors member.

Good hotel. Coordinator of a bus tour of 45 people. Spent 3 nights in this hotel and did not hear one complaint from the group. Prices were better than most Hampton Inns. Very helpful staff. Beds very comfortable bathroom clean plenty of linens supplied. nice amenities. Restaurants within walking distance. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Just the way it should be. Check in and room selection was fast and easy online. The room was clean quiet and very comfortable with all the usual amenities. The complimentary breakfast was tasty with enough variety to be interesting sausage cheese omelets cereal waffles fresh fruit oatmeal yogurt and all the usual drinks pastry and breads. Check out was quick and easy. Parking was sufficient but a bit crowded due to a full house. Pricing was competitive. Overall you could not ask for any better for the price.

Service was very good for the most part but the rooms were sub par. My AC did not cool the room and felt very moist in the room for the night. The bathroom was also sub par and not very clean. The hotel was affordable but I have been to better places for the same price.

Left there this morning and never been so happy to leave a Hampton Inn. Clogged bathtub dirty bathroom floor lukewarm breakfast and terrible coffee. The fitness room was closed due to three massive leaks in the ceiling. The pool was open but there was a leak in that ceiling too. Not up to typical Hampton standards by any stretch of the imagination.

First Disappointment At A Hampton Inn. We stay at a Hampton Inn all the time and this one was the first that has been a total disappointment. Our family had three rooms and everyone of them had black stains on the shower floors. The bathroom floors were dirty. I wiped up some water on the bathroom floor and the towel was black from the grime on the floor. Our sons room had blood splattered on the wall and floor. There were dogs next to my daughters room that barked continuously. The land line phone in my room did not have a cord to plug into the wall. The carpet was coming apart at the seams. The patio chairs were absolutely thread bear. This hotel is no doubt an older one but there is no excuse for the above complaints. The ONY positive that I can say about this hotel is the staff. They were friendly and accommodating. However the staff would not be enough to make me want to return to this hotel again. This hotel needs to be completely updated. This hotel does not meet the quality of a Hampton Inn.

Definitely NOT up to Hampton Inn Standards. I use Hampton Inns almost exclusively when I travel so I have been to a lot of them in many states. This one does not live up to the brand. The refrigerator in my room was beat up and not inside the cabinet made for it. Wonder why. The ceiling in the pool area is falling apart and has been badly repaired in one place. There is mold in the shower tub area gross. The room thermostat would not hold a temperature. The hotel does not have a guest laundry not all of them do but that would have been a nice thing. Instead I had to schlep my clothes to a laundromat and spend 6 for one load. I was just surprised that it was not up to the brands standards and wonder if Hampton has inspectors that visit properties to ensure they are meeting the Hilton standard. If so this property is due a visit and some fixing.

If you want dirty rooms stay here. Easy off on of I75. Front desk very friendly and helpful. However I was here for 3 days and called issues with cleanliness of room the first morning to front desk. Said would tell housekeeping. After told multiple times the dust bunnies were still by A C unit and dirt still on bathroom room floor. The housekeeping staff obviously do not care and IMHO should be shown the door.

Worst experience in Lexington. I came to Lexington on business this week and reserved at this Hampton for location reasons. When I arrived I saw that there were no external lights on and the facing of the hotel was missing. When I entered the hotel it was obvious that they are undergoing renovation. The website did not indicate that when I was booking prior to arrival. I knew from the hallway that the state of the room would likely not be great. It was dirty disheveled and unfit for guests to say the least. I understand that when hotels renovate they have some inconveniences but this was beyond that.

Under Construction but still nice stay. When we drove up we were pretty worried as the lawn had not been mowed and the grounds were in bad shape. There was a big dumpster next to it and when I looked up I could see that rooms were being remodeled. Our room however was nice and clean. The breakfast was very nice and the staff was helpful and courteous. The hotel feels old elevators was old but again our room was nice. It is conveniently located next to Keneland and to many restaurants.

Disappointing. Location. I have stayed at this hotel in the past and it was very good. I understand that they are undergoing reconstruction but the floors were dirty in the lobby and our bathroom floor was dirty when we checked in. they came in and vacuumed and mopped. On the 2nd day housekeeping never came so our towels were all dirty and beds not made. they apologized and comped the room for one night but it was still disappointing.

Clean and comfortable. My top criteria for hotels are cleanliness and comfort of the bed. This hotel was immaculate beds were great and staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was consistent with other Hampton Inns as good as you would expect for being complimentary. About 10 minutes from downtown and UK. A little challenging to get to if you are arriving from the west side of Lexington. Would definitely return. The only problem we had was that our digital key did not work and the ap stated we had been checked out prior to our arrival. This could have had something to do with our very late arrival 230 am but fortunately the staff still had the reservation and the same room available. The next day the ap did not work for check out. This was strange as we have been H members for a long time with no ap problems. All in all excellent value and very happy with our stay.

Disappointing. We are Hilton Honors members and had to ask for our welcome amenity. Then we were given a room on the 2nd floor and the ice machine is out of order. Has a sign that says go to 1st or 3rd floor. Not a huge deal but seemingly unnecessary as the hotel was not full. Our room overlooked what appears to be the outdoor break area for employees and every so often our room would begin to smell of cigarette smoke. Unfortunately we noticed this when everyone was already in pjs and ready for bed and we were exhausted from traveling. I always bring a floor fan and we out the kids in the bed furthest from the window. They both have asthma. Luckily the fan helped a lot. The water from the sink was either scalding hot of freezing. The handle did not work well so no happy medium and then surprisingly the next morning no hot water in the shower. I brought both of these issues to the attention of the front desk. The gentlemen did say that our room was overlooking the designated smoking area. I commented that it seemed like a bad choice to put an Honors member there and he looked at me like I was crazy. Ok but we are brand loyal so nice the area or put a walk in guest there. Breakfast was not great either. We will not be staying here again.
